Package javelin.model.world.location.dungeon.feature

Class Trap

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.world.location.dungeon.feature.Feature
      • javelin.model.world.location.dungeon.feature.Trap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Trap
extends Feature
    A trap is a semi-permanent strategic dungeon feature that deals subdual (non-lethal) damage to a single character. It is balanced by generating more Chest. Traps are currently on the average party CR -5 to -8 so as to be easy encounters. It's no fun to step onto a hard trap you didn't see coming and possibly lose the game. They are there more as a strategic path consideration when exploring a dungeon. In d20 traps are supposed to award XP as well as gold. This isn't done here partly because since the traps are permanent (so as to be strategic) it would be easy to continually step on traps to plunder xp. TODO evasion upgrade (half damage/no damage instead of full/half)
    Author:
    alex

      • discover

        public void discover​(Combatant searching,
                     int searchroll)
        Description copied from class: Feature
        Called when the Squad is passing nearby this feature. If it's hidden, might have a chance of revealing it.
        Overrides:
        discover in class Feature
        Parameters:
        searching - The unit that is actively looking around (usually the one with highest perception).
        searchroll - A Perception roll (usually a take-10, to prevent scumming). If you want to have an automatic success, inform a high number like 9000, because if you use Integer.MAX_VALUE, it may overflow after internal bonuses being applied.
        See Also:
        Feature.draw
